intro: Morphixia versicolor, commonly known as the variable beautyflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that change hue depending on environmental conditions. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Morphixia versicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
